Course Name: ACG 3401 - BUSINESS PROCESSES AND ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEMS
Course Title: BUSINESS PROCESSES AND ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEMS
Prerequisites:
ACG 2021 AND ACG 2071 WITH MINIMUM GRADES OF B, AND CGS 2531 OR ISM
3013
Course Description: EXAMINATION OF THE ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEMS IN A BUSINESS ORGANIZATION.  COVERAGE EXTENDS OVER TOPICS SUCH AS BUSINESS PROCESSES, INTERNAL CONTROLS, AND THE FUNDAMENTALS OF ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEMS ANALYSIS, DESIGN, IMPLEMENTATION AND CONTROL.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
ACCURATELY DESCRIBE AND DOCUMENT THE TYPES AND FLOW OF ACCOUNTING INFORMATION WITHIN A
BUSINESS ORGANIZATION AND TO IDENTIFY AND APPLY APPROPRIATE INTERNAL CONTROLS USING AN
UNDERSTANDING OF THE BUSINESS PROCESSES OF THE FIRM.
Textbook(s):
ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEMS BY JAMES HALL. SOUTH-WESTERN CENGAGE, 7TH ED.
IN ADDITION, COMPUTERIZED ACCOUNTING USING MICROSOFT DYNAMIS GP 10.0 5TH EDITION (2010) BY
AHRENS AND WARD. ARMOND DALTON PUBLISHING
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
